headline: Trump in Davos, SCOTUS hearing, J&J earnings: What to Watch
summary: Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton previews several of the biggest stories to come tomorrow, Wednesday, January 21, including President Trump's speech at the World Economic Forum (WEF) in Davos, Switzerland, the US Supreme Court (SCOTUS) hearing on whether the administration has the ability to fire Federal Reserve governor Lisa Cook, US pending homes sales, and quarterly earnings reports from companies like Johnson & Johnson (JNJ), Charles Schwab (SCHW), and Haliburton (HAL). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Does Steady Expectations and Low Short Interest Quietly Recast Charles Schwab’s Risk Narrative (SCHW)?
summary: In the past week, Charles Schwab drew attention ahead of its upcoming earnings release as analysts maintained revenue and earnings forecasts while short interest as a share of float eased to 0.89%, well below peers. At the same time, Schwab’s research arm highlighted how most crypto value sits in foundational blockchains and everyday tools, underlining its message that digital assets remain speculative and high-risk even as mainstream access grows. With earnings expectations holding steady...
